c.t: Chapter 05 Boxing and Kickboxing Facilities and Equipment

Four in number with a minimum diameter of 1 inch;

A boxer who flagrantly or repeatedly commits a foul may be:
Hitting below the belt;
Hitting an opponent who is down or getting up after being down;
Holding;
Wrestling or kicking;
Striking an opponent who is helpless as a result of blows and supported by
Butting with the head or shoulder or using the knee;
Hitting with the open glove, or with the butt of the hand, the wrist, or th
Going down without being hit;
Striking at that part of the body over the kidney;
The rabbit punch;
Jabbing the opponent's eye with the thumb of the glove;
Using abusive language in the ring;
Using an unsportsmanlike trick or action causing injury to an opponent;
Hitting on the break;
Hitting after the bell has sounded ending the round;
Roughing at the ropes;
Pushing an opponent about the ring or into the ropes; and
Biting.

Closed hand strikes to head and body;
Kicking techniques to body;
Knees to body and legs;
Throws, takedowns, and sweeps;
Standing submissions;
Chokes;
Arm bars; and
Shouldering.
The following techniques are permissible in amateur mixed martial arts whil
Closed hand strikes to the body and legs; and
Chokes;
Arm bars; or
Straight leg locks.
Submissions restricted to those accomplished by:
The following techniques are permissible in amateur mixed martial arts whil
Striking an opponent with the elbows;
Striking with the knees to the head of an opponent;
Kicking the knees of an opponent;
Stomping the feet of an opponent;
Striking the groin of an opponent;
Striking the back of an opponent's head;
Striking the spine of an opponent;
Slamming an opponent to the ground;
Throwing an opponent onto his or her head or neck;
Throwing an opponent against a joint;
Throwing an opponent out of the competition area;
Cranking the neck of an opponent;
Pinching, biting, or gouging an opponent;
Holding onto the ropes of enclosure; and
Striking or kicking the kidney of an opponent.
The following techniques are not permissible in amateur mixed martial arts
Any striking of an opponent's head;
Any striking of an opponent with an elbow;
Cranking of an opponent's neck;
Hooking an opponent's heel;
Locking an opponent's finger or toe;
Choking an opponent by the placement of a hand on the opponent's throat;
Smothering an opponent by the placement of a hand over the opponent's mouth
Locking an opponent's spine;
Placing an opponent in a hammer lock;
Fish hooking an opponent;
Striking an opponent in the groin;
Striking an opponent in the spine;
Slamming an opponent to the ground;
Throwing an opponent out of the competition area;
Pinching, biting, or gouging an opponent;
Twisting an opponent's leg, knee, or ankle; and
Striking or kicking the kidney of an opponent.
The following techniques are not permissible in amateur mixed martial arts
